title: Hugh Jackman on Wolverine Return: â€˜I Am Never Saying Never Againâ€™
description: Hugh Jackman recently appeared on â€œThe Graham Norton Showâ€ (via Entertainment Weekly) where he proclaimed that he will never say he is never playing
body:
Hugh Jackman recently appeared on â€œThe Graham Norton Showâ€ (via Entertainment Weekly) where he proclaimed that he will never say he is never playing Wolverine again. Jackman announced he was done playing the iconic X-Men superhero after 2017â€™s â€œLogan,â€ which ended with the characterâ€™s death. But Jackman wasnâ€™t being truthful. He returned as Wolverine seven years later in the 2024 Marvel blockbuster â€œDeadpool and Wolverine.â€

	â€œEvery time youâ€™re on [talk show], you gotta go, â€˜Nope, Iâ€™m not doing that again,â€™ But then you keep making another one. And itâ€™s a big big hit. So are you gonna have to do it again?â€ Jackman said. â€œMaybe. I am never saying â€˜neverâ€™ ever againâ€¦ But I did mean it when I said â€˜neverâ€™ [the first time], until the day when I changed my mind. But I really did for quite a few years, I meant it.â€
	

	During last yearâ€™s â€œDeadpool and Wolverineâ€ press tour, Jackman admitted that his feelings about staying in retirement from Wolverine were complicated after he saw the first â€œDeadpoolâ€ movie.

	â€œI was like, â€˜Those two characters together.â€™ I knew it. I knew the fans wanted it ever since I put on the claws, people talked about these two. So, that had always been there, but I just knew,â€ he told Fandango. â€œI rang Ryan [Reynolds]. And I just said, â€˜Letâ€™s do it.â€™ Like, I hadnâ€™t rung my agent, no one. I had to ring my agent and said, â€˜Oh, by the way, I have just committed to a movie.â€™â€

	But not everyone was initially sold on the idea of Jackman coming back as Wolverine. Marvel Studios president Kevin FeigeÂ confirmed to EmpireÂ that he originally warned Jackman against playing Wolverine again.
	

	â€œI said, â€˜Let me give you a piece of advice, Hugh. Donâ€™t come back,â€™â€ Feige said. â€œâ€˜You had the greatest ending in history withÂ â€˜Logan.â€™ Thatâ€™s not something we should undo.â€™â€

	As Marvel movie fans eventually found out in â€œDeadpool and Wolverine,â€ Jackman did not return as the iteration of Wolverine he played for decades and hung up in â€œLogan.â€ Marvelâ€™s multiverse allowed the actor to play a new variant of Wolverine. Whether or not Jackman pops up as the mutant in next yearâ€™s â€œAvengers: Doomsdayâ€ or its sequel, â€œAvengers: Secret Wars,â€ remains to be seen. Many of Jackmanâ€™s original â€œX-Menâ€ co-stars, from Ian McKellen to Patrick Stewart and James Marsden, are appearing in â€œDoomsday.â€

schema.headline: Hugh Jackman on Wolverine Return: â€˜I Am Never Saying Never Againâ€™

title: â€˜Fortnite Festivalâ€™ Sets LISA as Season 12 Icon
description: Epic Games has revealed that singer, rapper, dancer and actress LISA will be the Icon for its next â€œFortnite Festival.â€ The multi-hyphenate K-pop su
body:
Epic Games has revealed that singer, rapper, dancer and actress LISA will be the Icon for its next â€œFortnite Festival.â€ The multi-hyphenate K-pop superstar will take the stage for Season 12 of the in-game Fortnite event as the main act of the new â€œStarlux Music Pass,â€ which launches Nov. 29.

	The new â€œFortnite Festivalâ€ event will concur with the arrivals of a new Rockstar LISA OutfitÂ plusÂ â€œFXCK UP THE WORLD (Vixi Solo Version)â€ â€œRockstarâ€Â andÂ â€œNew Womanâ€Â jam tracks in the Fortnite Shop.
	

	Fortnite original act Melodie Mars will open for LISA at the event and the Starlux Music Pass will automatically unlock the Melodie Mars Outfit upon purchase.


	â€œI love seeing how Fortnite brought my alter egos to life in the game so perfectly,â€ LISA said. â€œBeing the main act for the Starlux Music Pass is an exciting opportunity for my fans to continue experiencing my favorite songs and outfits from my debut album, â€˜Alter Ego.â€™â€

	The most recent â€œFortnite Festivalâ€ Icon was Gorillaz, headlining the Season 10 event back in August. Season 11, titled â€œMixtape,â€ did not include one individual Icon and instead acted as a â€œcelebrationâ€ of Fortnite original music and rewards. 

	Previous Icons throughout the history of Epicâ€™s â€œFortnite Festivalâ€ include Bruno Mars (Season 9) Sabrina Carpenter (Season 8), Hatsune Miku (Season 7), Snoop Dogg (Season 6), Karol G (Season 5), Metallica (Season 4), Billie Eilish (Season 3), Lady Gaga (Season 2) and The Weeknd (Season 1).

	Watch the trailer for â€œFortnite Festivalâ€ Season 12 featuring new Icon LISA in the video below.

schema.headline: â€˜Fortnite Festivalâ€™ Sets LISA as Season 12 Icon

title: â€˜Industryâ€™ Season 4 Sets January Premiere Date as HBO Drops Stirring Teaser
description:
â€œIndustryâ€ is returning for business.

	Season 4 of the critically acclaimed drama series will debut on HBO and HBO Max on Jan. 11 at 9 p.m. ET. New
body:
â€œIndustryâ€ is returning for business.

	Season 4 of the critically acclaimed drama series will debut on HBO and HBO Max on Jan. 11 at 9 p.m. ET. New episodes of the eight-episode season will air weekly.

	The logline for the new season reads as follows: â€œAt the top of their game and living the lives they set out to have as Pierpoint grads, Harper (Myhaâ€™la) and Yasmin (Marisa Abela) are drawn into a high stakes, globetrotting cat-and-mouse game when a splashy fintech darling bursts onto the London scene. As Yasmin navigates her relationship with tech founder Sir Henry Muck (Kit Harington) and Harper is pulled into the orbit of enigmatic executive Whitney Halberstram (Max Minghella), their twisted friendship begins to warp and ignite under the pressure of money, power, and the desire to be on top.â€
	

	In a stirring teaser trailer backed by Nina Simoneâ€™s cover of â€œLilac Wine,â€ thereâ€™s blood, smoking, dancing, kissing and sex. Harper and Yasmin have a confrontation at a bar.


	â€œIndustryâ€ stars Myhaâ€™la, Marisa Abela, Kit Harington, Ken Leung, Max Minghella, Miriam Petche, Sagar Radia, Toheeb Jimoh, Charlie Heaton, Amy James-Kelly, Roger Barclay, Andrew Havill, Kiernan Shipka, Kal Penn, Jack Farthing, Stephen Campbell Moore, Claire Forlani and Edward Holcroft.

	The show is created and written by Mickey Down and Konrad Kay, who executive produce alongside Jane Tranter, Kate Crowther and Ryan Rasmussen for Bad Wolf Productions; Kathleen McCaffrey for Little Gems; and Rebecca Ferguson for BBC. Directors include Down and Kay, Michelle Savill and Luke Snellin.Â Â Â 
	

	Watch the teaser for Season 4 of â€œIndustryâ€ below.

schema.headline: â€˜Industryâ€™ Season 4 Sets January Premiere Date as HBO Drops Stirring Teaser

title: Mubi Hires Publicity Veteran VJ Carbone to Oversee the Companyâ€™s U.S. Film Campaigns and Expanding Presence (EXCLUSIVE)
description:
As it gears up for a busy awards season, Mubi has hired veteran publicity executive VJ Carbone as VP of communications in the U.S.. 

	Under his rol
body:
As it gears up for a busy awards season, Mubi has hired veteran publicity executive VJ Carbone as VP of communications in the U.S.. 

	Under his role at Mubi, Carbone will oversee publicity for the companyâ€™s U.S. film campaigns and expanding U.S. presence. He will be based in the New York office and will report to Sophie Rhatigan, Mubiâ€™s senior VP of communications for global.

	Mubi recently released Lynne Ramsayâ€™s psychological thriller â€œDie My Loveâ€ starring Jennifer Lawrence whose electric performance opposite Robert Pattinson has been critically lauded. The movie world premiered in competition at the Cannes Film Festival, went on to play at festivals around the world, and is now being touted by Mubi as a strong contender in the awards race, especially for the best actress category. Earlier this month, Mubi received nine Gotham Awards nominations, and 24 BIFA nominations (with Akinola Davies Jrâ€™sÂ â€œMy Fatherâ€™s Shadow,â€ a Mubi release, emerging as a frontrunner). The company is also behind the four films leading nominations at the European Film Awards with Joachim Trierâ€™s â€œSentimental Value,â€ Oliver Laxeâ€™s â€œSirat,â€ Masha Schilinskiâ€™s â€œSound of Fallingâ€ and Jafar Panahiâ€™s â€œIt Was Just an Accident.â€ 
	

	â€œWe are thrilled to welcome VJ to Mubi,â€ said Rhatigan. â€œHis experience, reputation, and passion for cinema make him an excellent addition to our team at a moment when supporting strong independent storytelling matters more than ever,â€ the executive continued. 


	Carbone, who was most recently a consultant at Amazon MGM Studios where he led campaigns on â€œBones and All,â€ â€œChallengersâ€ and â€œBoys in the Boat,â€ said he was â€œhonored to join the remarkable Mubi team.â€
	

	â€œIâ€™ve dedicated my career to championing great films and filmmakers, and Iâ€™m excited to bring my experience to the work ahead and to help amplify the voices, projects, and vision that make Mubi so special,â€ he continued. 

	Prior to his time at Amazon MGM Studios, Carbone spent a combined 14 years at Focus Features, working on such titles as â€œBrokeback Mountain,â€ â€œThe Constant Gardener,â€ â€œAtonement,â€ â€œSomewhere,â€ â€œMoonrise Kingdomâ€ and â€œDowntown Abbey.â€ He is the co-founder of the Asbury Park Film Initiative, a non-profit film-based organization promoting culture, education and diversity.Â 

	Mubiâ€™s theatrical releases in the U.S. this year include Paolo Sorrentinoâ€™s â€œLa Graziaâ€ starring Toni Servillo, who won the Coppa Volpi Prize for best actor at Venice, and Jim Jarmuschâ€™s â€œFather Mother Sister Brother,â€ which won the Golden Lion Venice.

schema.headline: Mubi Hires Publicity Veteran VJ Carbone to Oversee the Companyâ€™s U.S. Film Campaigns and Expanding Presence (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Dorothy Speaks! â€˜Wicked: For Goodâ€™ Actor Bethany Weaver Says Taking Over Judy Garlandâ€™s Iconic Role Was a â€˜Life-Changing Experienceâ€™
description: â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ viewers might never see her face, but the actor Bethany Weaver plays a huge role in the blockbuster musical sequel. Weaver takes
body:
â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ viewers might never see her face, but the actor Bethany Weaver plays a huge role in the blockbuster musical sequel. Weaver takes over the role of Dorothy Gale, originally played by Judy Garland in 1939â€™s â€œThe Wizard of Oz.â€ The actor took to Instagram during â€œWicked: For Goodâ€™sâ€ record-breaking opening weekend to reveal herself as the filmâ€™s Dorothy.

	â€œThis has been a life changing experience, itâ€™s changed me in so many ways and most importantly, for good,â€ Weaver wrote alongside behind-the-scenes photos from the â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ set. â€œItâ€™s been an honor to carry the legacy of the brilliant women before me who have stepped into these shoes, and embarked on the yellow brick road. I hope I have made them proud. Thank you for the sheer volume of love, kind messages and support from all of my friends and family and the glorious wicked fans, I love you all so much!â€
	

	Weaver, a relative newcomer who makes her feature film debut in â€œWicked: For Good,â€ proceeded to thank the filmâ€™s casting director, costume designer and make-up artists for helping her land and transform into the role of Dorothy. She also thanked the movieâ€™s director, Jon M. Chu, writing: â€œA huge thank you to the best filmmaker of all time for choosing me to be your Dorothy in this wonderfully wicked universe called Oz. Thank you for contributing to starting my beginning.â€

	The plot of â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ unfolds concurrently with that of â€œThe Wizard of Oz.â€ In keeping in line with the Broadway musical, where Dorothy is never seen, the movie version only shows Dorothy from the back as she walks down the Yellow Brick Road and stands before the Wizard, who instructs her to bring him the broom of the Wicked Witch once sheâ€™s been vanquished.
	

	â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ rocked the box office with a $150 million domestic debut, which is the biggest opening in history for a Broadway film adaptation. The sequelâ€™s launch was also much higher than the $112 million that the first â€œWickedâ€ movie launched to in 2024. These ticket sales also rank as the yearâ€™s second-biggest opening behind Aprilâ€™s â€œA Minecraft Movieâ€ ($162 million).

	â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ is now playing in theaters nationwide from Universal Pictures. Read Weaverâ€™s full Instagram post below.

schema.headline: Dorothy Speaks! â€˜Wicked: For Goodâ€™ Actor Bethany Weaver Says Taking Over Judy Garlandâ€™s Iconic Role Was a â€˜Life-Changing Experienceâ€™

title: HBO Max Black Friday Deal: 73% Off Basic Plan With Ads for One Year
description:
Warner Bros. Discovery is hoping to lock in new and returning HBO Max customers with a one-week Black Friday promotion. 

	Beginning Monday, eligibl
body:
Warner Bros. Discovery is hoping to lock in new and returning HBO Max customers with a one-week Black Friday promotion. 

	Beginning Monday, eligible subscribers can sign up for HBO Maxâ€™s Basic With Ads plan with a special Black Friday offer of $2.99 per month for the first 12 months, which is a discount of 73% off the regular price of $10.99 per month. After the promotional period expires, the rates will go back to the standard price.
	

	The limited-time offer is available through next Monday, Dec. 1, 2025, for new and returning subscribers on HBOMax.com, Apple, Google Play, Roku, Samsung, Xumo and â€œadditional select partners,â€ and for new HBO Max customers only on Amazon Fire TV.


	HBO Max is the streaming home for exclusive original series, blockbuster movies, and documentaries, as well as a library of TV shows and films from brands like HBO, Warner Bros., A24 and the DC Universe.

	In the third quarter of 2025, Warner Bros. Discovery tallied 128.0 million streaming subscribers, an increase of 2.3 million subscribers from Q2. Those include customers of HBO Max as well as Discovery+ and its sports-streaming services.

	HBO Maxâ€™s upcoming lineup of programming includes the recently released HBO originals â€œI Love LA,â€ â€œThe Chair Company,â€ â€œIT: Welcome to Derryâ€ and â€œThe Seductionâ€; documentaries â€œAlex vs. ARod,â€ â€œOne to One: John & Yokoâ€ and â€œThoughts & Prayers.â€ The streamer also includes favorite older TV titles like â€œFriendsâ€ and â€œThe Big Bang Theory.â€ HBO Max also offers movies from Warner Bros. Pictures, DC Studios, Turner Classic Movies, A24, Studio Ghibli and more, including films like â€œWeaponsâ€ and â€œThe Substanceâ€ and fan-favorite franchises like Harry Potter, The Conjuring and Final Destination.
	

	Coming in 2026 to HBO Max are new series â€œA Knight of the Seven Kingdoms,â€ â€œHalf Man,â€ â€œDTF St. Louisâ€ and â€œLanterns,â€ plus new seasons of â€œIndustry,â€ â€œHacks,â€ â€œThe Pitt,â€ â€œEuphoriaâ€ and â€œGame of Thronesâ€ spinoff â€œHouse of the Dragon.â€ 

	WBD also touted HBO Maxâ€™s lineup of Christmas movies on the service, including â€œElf,â€ â€œNational Lampoonâ€™s Christmas Vacation,â€ â€œA Christmas Story,â€ â€œThe Polar Expressâ€ and the streaming premiere of â€œThe Family McMullenâ€ (on Dec. 5).

schema.headline: HBO Max Black Friday Deal: 73% Off Basic Plan With Ads for One Year

title: â€˜Wickedâ€™: How Universalâ€™s Risky Gamble to Split the Musical Into Two Movies Paid Off at the Box Office
description:
More than a few eyebrows were raised around Hollywood when Universal decided to turn â€œWickedâ€ into two separate films.

	Yes, the stage show has bee
body:
More than a few eyebrows were raised around Hollywood when Universal decided to turn â€œWickedâ€ into two separate films.

	Yes, the stage show has been a sensation on Broadway for decades. But itâ€™s a risk to split any movie in half and count on audiences to return a year or more later for the conclusion. Musicals are already a polarizing genre, and in this case, Universal needed to turn two (!) of them into blockbusters to justify the expensive gamble. After all, the studio spent a combined $300 million on production and roughly $250 million on marketing for 2024â€™s â€œWickedâ€ and the follow-up, â€œWicked: For Good.â€
	

	Although the Oz dust has yet to settle, itâ€™s clear the financial gambit has paid off. â€œWickedâ€ struck a chord with $758 million globally, making the film the highest grossing Broadway adaptation in box office history (for now). Thatâ€™s to say nothing of riches on premium video-on-demand (where the film earned a mighty $70 million in just its first week) as well as 10 Oscar nominations.


	A year later, fans werenâ€™t able to resist Ozâ€™s gravitational pull, returning in force for the epic finale of Elphaba (Cynthia Erivo) and Glinda (Ariana Grande). â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ was even more popular than its predecessor in terms of opening weekend, collecting a dazzling $150 million domestically and $226 million worldwide. By comparison, the first film opened to $112.5 million domestically and $164 million globally.

	â€œThe excitement and energy around this weekendâ€™s opening was tremendous and cut across all categories of cinema-goers: young, old, women and men,â€ says Sean Gamble, CEO of Cinemark, one of the countryâ€™s largest theater chains.
	

	Back in 2022, director Jon M. Chu explained the decision behind the two-parter as a creative necessity, saying the story â€” which takes place before, during and after the events of â€œThe Wizard of Ozâ€ â€” was too expansive to be contained to two hours and change. At that point, Universal had been developing the film for nearly 20 years. â€œIt became impossible to wrestle the story of â€˜Wickedâ€™ into a single film without doing some real damage to it,â€ Chu said ahead of production. â€œWe decided to give ourselves a bigger canvas and make not just one â€˜Wickedâ€™ movie but two!â€

	Fans of â€œWickedâ€ were concerned because the stage showâ€™s second half is dramatically shorter, darker and less cohesive than Act One, which has most of the songs (â€œDefying Gravity,â€ â€œPopularâ€ and â€œWhat Is This Feeling?â€ among them) that audiences know and love. Critics werenâ€™t as charmed by â€œFor Good,â€ which scored a 70% on Rotten Tomatoes while the original film earned an 88% average. But audiences remain obsessulated, awarding the second installment an â€œAâ€ grade on CinemaScore, just like the first. With strong audience scores, goodwill toward the pink-and-green property, and a prime release date ahead of Thanksgiving, â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ is poised for a long and winding theatrical run.

	â€œThis was a risk before anyone knew how it would turn out,â€ says analyst Shawn Robbins, director of movie analytics at Fandango and founder of Box Office Theory. â€œThe first film, which had an incredible fan turnout, was the marketing for the second film. There was no better way to release it.â€

	Before â€œWicked,â€ Hollywood hadnâ€™t triumphantly adapted a stage show for the screen in over a decade â€” you have to go back to 2012â€™s â€œLes Miserablesâ€ ($442 million globally) or 2014â€™s â€œInto the Woodsâ€ ($212 million) to find a big musical hit. Thatâ€™s not for lack of trying. Yet recent attempts like Steven Spielbergâ€™s 2021 â€œWest Side Storyâ€ remake ($76 million against a $100 million budget), Chuâ€™s 2021 â€œIn the Heightsâ€ ($45 million against a $55 million budget), 2021â€™s â€œDear Evan Hansenâ€ ($19 million against $28 million budget), 2019â€™s â€œCatsâ€ ($78 million against a $100 million budget) and 2023â€™s â€œThe Color Purpleâ€ ($68 million against $100 million budget) all faltered on the big screen despite being based on popular productions.
	

	â€œMusicals are challenging to execute,â€ says Robbins. â€œIn a lot of those cases, they werenâ€™t crowd-pleasers or missed the mark on a creative level. Others were darker and just werenâ€™t suitable to commercial audiences outside of Broadway fans.â€

	Hollywood has also learned the hard way that splitting a blockbuster into two films doesnâ€™t necessarily double the profits. Director Denis Villeneuve succeeded with 2021â€™s â€œDune: Part Oneâ€ and 2024â€™s â€œDune Part Two,â€ which brought Frank Herbertâ€™s sprawling sci-fi novel to the screen to outsized box office results. Otherwise, two-part releases have worked when capping off long-running franchises, like â€œHarry Potter,â€ â€œTwilightâ€ and â€œThe Hunger Games.â€ In some cases, requiring a second (or third) trip to cinemas for the competed story can feel like a cash grab Ã  la â€œMission: Impossible â€“ Dead Reckoning Part Two,â€ which was renamed to â€œThe Final Reckoningâ€ after â€œPart Oneâ€ fizzled at the box office, or Kevin Costnerâ€™s four-part â€œHorizon: An American Saga,â€ which probably wonâ€™t pull off its multi-installment ambitions after the first chapter misfired in theaters.

	Universal made good by turning â€œWickedâ€ into a leave-the-home-worthy event. For the studio, that involved producing a two-hour NBC musical special â€œWicked: One Wonderful Night,â€ partnering with 400 consumer brands such as Dunkin and American Girl, and promoting the movie in less expected places like on ESPN. An added challenge was needing to keep the musical property in the zeitgeist for two years without wearing out audiences. 

	â€œOur marketing department made â€˜Wickedâ€™ something you had to see to be part of the excitement,â€ says Universalâ€™s domestic distribution chief Jim Orr. â€œThatâ€™s not easy to do.â€

	At this point, Universal executives are humming a similar tune as Glinda in â€œWicked: For Goodâ€™sâ€ opening sequence: â€œWho wouldnâ€™t be happier?â€

schema.headline: â€˜Wickedâ€™: How Universalâ€™s Risky Gamble to Split the Musical Into Two Movies Paid Off at the Box Office

title: George Clooney to Receive Film at Lincoln Centerâ€™s Chaplin Award
description:
George Clooney will be honored with Film at Lincoln Centerâ€™s 51st Chaplin Award. He will be feted at a gala on April 27.Â 
	This recognition comes af
body:
George Clooney will be honored with Film at Lincoln Centerâ€™s 51st Chaplin Award. He will be feted at a gala on April 27.Â 
	This recognition comes after Clooneyâ€™s latest film, â€œJay Kelly,â€ played at the New York Film Festival, hosted by Film at Lincoln Center. Clooney has been in the Oscar conversation for â€œJay Kelly,â€ in which he plays an aging movie star who faces a personal and professional reckoning. So he embarks on a journey through Europe â€” traveling by planes, trains and automobiles â€” with his long-time manager (Adam Sandler) as the two reflect on their life choices, relationships and legacies.Â 
	
	â€œIt was a true pleasure to welcome George Clooney to Film at Lincoln Center in September for the premiere of â€˜Jay Kelly,â€™ a highlight of the 63rd New York Film Festival,â€ said Daniel Battsek, FLC President. â€œWe are honored to invite him back to celebrate a professional life that reflects such extraordinary range and purpose. From award-winning performances to standout producing work to acclaimed directing, George brings a distinctive blend of intelligence, craft, and social conscience to everything he does. His contributions continue to inspire audiences and artists around the world.â€Â 

	One of Hollywoodâ€™s biggest stars, Clooneyâ€™s influence spans television and film, starting with his breakout role on â€œERâ€ and continuing with films such as â€œSyriana,â€ â€œO Brother Where Art Thou,â€ â€œUp in the Airâ€ and the â€œOceansâ€ trilogy. His work also recently extended to the stage, earning a Tony nomination for his Broadway debut in â€œGood Night, and Good Luck,â€ a play based on his film of the same name. Clooney is also known for his humanitarian efforts, advocating for the First Amendment as well as the human-rights campaigns for the crises in Darfur in Sudan.
	
	â€œGeorge Clooney embodies a rare blend of artistry, generosity, humor, and integrity. His unmistakable on-screen charisma is matched by the excellence he brings behind the camera as a director and producer, consistently using his influence to champion emerging talent and shine a light on urgent humanitarian issues around the world,â€ said Dan Stern, chairman of the FLC Board of Directors. â€œWe are proud to present George with the 51st Chaplin Award, placing him among the cinematic luminaries who have received this honor over the last half-century.â€Â Presented each year at Lincoln Centerâ€™s Alice Tully Hall, the Chaplin Award recognizes an individualâ€™s significant contributions to the art of cinema. Past recipients have included Pedro AlmodÃ³var, Viola Davis, Cate Blanchett, Spike Lee, Meryl Streep, Martin Scorsese, Robert Redford, Sidney Poitier, and Gregory Peck.

schema.headline: George Clooney to Receive Film at Lincoln Centerâ€™s Chaplin Award

title: Dorra Zarrouk on Directing Debut â€˜The Life That Remains,â€™ Dohaâ€™s Growing Film Ecosystem, and Two Decades of Screen Stardom
description: Tunisian actress Dorra Zarrouk (â€œWhispering Sandsâ€) was in Doha for the launch of the cityâ€™s inaugural film festival, bringing with her the perspect
body:
Tunisian actress Dorra Zarrouk (â€œWhispering Sandsâ€) was in Doha for the launch of the cityâ€™s inaugural film festival, bringing with her the perspective of an actor who has recently expanded her work behind the camera. After two decades as one of the Arab worldâ€™s most recognizable screen talents, she made her directing debut last year with the documentary â€œThe Life That Remains,â€ which continues to travel on the festival circuit.
	

	â€œThe Life That Remainsâ€ follows a young Gazan woman, Nadine, and her family as they flee the war and attempt to rebuild their lives in Egypt. Shot largely in intimate, domestic spaces, the documentary traces their displacement with a focus on everyday resilience rather than political commentary.


	At the Doha Film Festival, Zarrouk spoke with Variety about the filmâ€™s urgent origins, the growing role of festivals in the region, and the discipline behind sustaining a long career.


	Youâ€™re attending the first edition of the Doha Film Festival. What does this launch represent for you and for the region?Itâ€™s a great pleasure to be here. A first edition is always special, and I think itâ€™s important for Qatar to have a festival of this scale. It completes something that has already been happening, especially with the Doha Film Institute consistently supporting independent and engaged films. Of course they canâ€™t support everything, but that belief matters. A festival connects those films with audiences, so that link is essential.

	How did â€œThe Life That Remainsâ€ come about?I didnâ€™t plan to direct at all. But watching what was happening in Gaza, I felt powerless. As an actress, you can post or speak on social media, but it didnâ€™t feel like enough. Then I received a message on Instagram from Nadine, a young woman fleeing Gaza with her two babies to Egypt. She wasnâ€™t asking me for help; she just wanted to say they were leaving. There was so much dignity in that message. I felt I had to tell her story. I didnâ€™t wait for producers or funding, I just did it.
	

	How did you convince Nadine and her family to participate? Were they hesitant?She wasnâ€™t hesitant, just surprised. These are people who had never been filmed before. When I mentioned the idea, she said, â€œLet me ask my husband,â€ and then came back and said, â€œWe agree.â€ When youâ€™ve lost everything, a project like this can feel like a small ray of hope. Once we started shooting, her younger sisters would call me on off-days asking, â€œWhen do we film again?â€ Theyâ€™d lost their routines. Filming gave them something to hold on to.

	How did you build the trust needed to film the family so closely?Trust is everything. She knew me as an actress, so I wasnâ€™t a total stranger walking in with a camera, which helped. But I was very aware of my responsibility. I didnâ€™t want to put them in danger or expose them in unwanted ways. I wanted to film their dignity, not their misfortune. One sister cried in front of the camera and told me to remove it because sheâ€™s known as â€œthe strong one.â€ But that moment, bringing strength and fragility together, is the truth I wanted the film to hold.

	What were the reactions from the family and from audiences when they saw the finished film?The first screening was at the Cairo Film Festival. The whole family came, and many Palestinians. A woman came to me crying, saying she saw herself in the film. For the family, it was emotional. Nothing in the film made them uncomfortable, but it brought back memories, some of them painful. At every festival, Carthage, Rotterdam, the reaction has been emotional. People donâ€™t always expect that from documentaries, but sometimes reality carries more emotion than fiction.

	Youâ€™ve said that in documentary â€œyou sometimes have to make the film now,â€ while fiction allows for more time. How do you see these two modes fitting into the industry at the moment?Documentary canâ€™t wait. The story is happening, you feel urgency, and you move with it. Fiction has a different rhythm where you can take your time to write, develop, build the world, and secure funding. Both are necessary in the region. We need films that respond directly to the present moment, and we also need fiction that takes years to craft. What matters is that the industry creates space for both forms and both timelines.
	

	Earlier you said a festival â€œcompletes the processâ€ by connecting films to audiences. What role do you think a new event like Doha can play within the Arab film ecosystem?A festival isnâ€™t only for filmmakers, itâ€™s where the public finally meets the films. In our region we have many important stories and talented directors, but they need visibility and a space to show their work. When a festival like Doha begins, it creates a place for discovery, for new voices to emerge, and for the industry to grow. I think this festival will expand, and thatâ€™s important for everyone making films here.

	What did you discover about yourself by directing for the first time?Freedom. When you act, you serve someone elseâ€™s vision. When you direct, you create your own universe. I loved discovering more about editing, sound, color, all the parts of filmmaking Iâ€™d never touched. It was a completely different experience to not be in front of the camera. It allowed me space to just be while on set. Iâ€™ll direct again, maybe fiction next time, but only if the story calls me.

	What do you credit for your longevity in an industry that changes so quickly?Longevity is much more difficult than achieving success once. In this profession there are always ups and downs with moments when youâ€™re working nonstop and others when youâ€™re not getting the right proposals, or when the spotlight simply isnâ€™t on you. You have to know how to live through that. Iâ€™ve had periods of doubt, moments that were very hard, but you have to admit when something hasnâ€™t worked, get up again and reinvent yourself. A film, a series, a play, you never know if it will succeed or not, so you learn not to panic. You learn to ask, â€œWhat am I doing in these quiet moments? How do I transform myself for the next step?â€ For me, the most important thing is to stay grounded. Donâ€™t think, â€œIâ€™m a star and this will last forever.â€ You have to keep your feet on the ground, stay steady, keep learning, and keep moving forward. Thatâ€™s what allows you to continue.

schema.headline: Dorra Zarrouk on Directing Debut â€˜The Life That Remains,â€™ Dohaâ€™s Growing Film Ecosystem, and Two Decades of Screen Stardom

title: Rupert Grint Wrote Letter to New Ron Weasley Actor Before HBOâ€™s â€˜Harry Potterâ€™ Started Filming: â€˜Itâ€™s Quite Strange to Have the Cycle Happening Againâ€™
description: Rupert Grint recently told the BBC that he wrote new Ron Weasley actor Alastair StoutÂ a letter before the child actor started production on HBOâ€™s â€œH
body:
Rupert Grint recently told the BBC that he wrote new Ron Weasley actor Alastair StoutÂ a letter before the child actor started production on HBOâ€™s â€œHarry Potterâ€ television series. Grint played Ron in the eight-film â€œHarry Potterâ€ franchise from 2001 to 2011. HBOâ€™s series reboot will feature Stout as Ron opposite fellow newcomers Dominic McLaughlin as Harry and Arabella Stanton as Hermione.

	â€œI wrote him a letter before they started, passing the baton as it were,â€ Grint said. â€œIt was really just wishing him all the best with it. I had so much fun stepping into this world, and I hope he has the same experienceâ€¦ Itâ€™s quite strange to have the cycle happening again. Iâ€™m really intrigued what itâ€™s going to be like.â€
	

	Grint acknowledged thereâ€™s â€œa bit of family resemblanceâ€ between himself and Stout, adding: â€œI think itâ€™s great that itâ€™s a whole new thing. Itâ€™s going to be its own thing, and I think that will be fun.â€


	Daniel Radcliffe, who played Harry Potter in the movie franchise, similarly reached out to the actor taking over his iconic role. Radcliffe said on â€œGood Morning Americaâ€ earlier this month that he wrote a letter to McLaughlin and got a â€œvery sweet note back.â€

	â€œI donâ€™t want to be a specter in the life of these children but I just wanted to write to him to say, â€˜I hope you have the best time, and an even better time than I did â€” I had a great time, but I hope you have an even better time,â€™â€ Radcliffe explained. â€œAnd I do, I just see these pictures of him and the other kids and I just want to hug them. They just seem so young. I just look at them and say, â€˜Oh, itâ€™s crazy I was doing that at that age.â€™ But itâ€™s also incredibly sweet and I hope theyâ€™re having a great time.â€
	

	Grint told the BBC that even with a new â€œHarry Potterâ€ adaptation on the way, heâ€™ll still â€œnever step out of Ron Weasleyâ€™s shadow.â€

	â€œIâ€™m fine with that. I think itâ€™s great,â€ he said. â€œI love meeting people who really felt this was part of their childhoodâ€¦ It has a quite deep meaning to a lot of people of my generation, and even more to generations who are finding it now. Itâ€™s great. It gives me a lot of pride. It was such a huge thing. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ll ever quite step out of his shadow, but Iâ€™m fine with that.â€

	Plus, Grint has always been an advocate for new actors to take over the franchise. Speaking to GQ Magazine UKÂ in July 2023 before HBO announced its â€œHarry Potterâ€ series reboot, Grint encouraged someone else to play Ron Weasley and added: â€œIâ€™d love to seeÂ â€˜Harry Potterâ€™Â be adapted into aÂ TV show. I think it would really work. Iâ€™m sure the films will get remade, anyway.â€

	The â€œHarry Potterâ€ series is set to debut on HBO and HBO Max in 2027.Â

schema.headline: Rupert Grint Wrote Letter to New Ron Weasley Actor Before HBOâ€™s â€˜Harry Potterâ€™ Started Filming: â€˜Itâ€™s Quite Strange to Have the Cycle Happening Againâ€™

title: Fistfight Erupts In Stands During Raiders Vs. Browns Game In Las Vegas
description:
Raiders vs. Browns
                          Fight Breaks Out In Stands
body:
Raiders vs. Browns
                          Fight Breaks Out In Stands
                          ... During Shedeur Sanders' NFL Debut
                      
                  
                        Published November 24, 2025 7:52 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          It was a rough afternoon for Raiders fans who made the trek to Allegiant Stadium just to watch Shedeur Sanders win his NFL debut for the Browns, but one man in particular had it worse ... as he was involved in a full-blown fistfight in the stands.
      
    
          Footage of the scrap started circulating on social media on Sunday. While it's unclear what led up to the incident, you can see a man in a No. 2 Raiders jersey land a solid punch on another spectator.
      
    
      
      Raiders fans: please stop beating up visiting fans before they even get a chance to lose money in the casinos. pic.twitter.com/H9t5YLPPl8â€” Las Vegas Locally ğŸŒ´ (@LasVegasLocally) November 23, 2025
              @LasVegasLocally
          
  
    
          The man -- alongside a patron in a Browns jersey -- is then held back by someone in an attempt to de-escalate the situation.
      

          Unfortunately for them ... their altercation ended up on officials' radars.
      
    
          After a cut in the video, you see the Raiders and Browns fans being escorted from their sections, with the Silver and Black supporter's hands behind his back.
      
    
          We reached out to the police to see if any arrests or citations were issued as a result of the incident.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          On the field ... it was all about Deion Sanders' son making his starting debut with the Browns, which saw Cleveland walk away with the 24-10 victory.
      
    
          Shedeur went 11/20 with a touchdown and an interception in the contest, all while his pops was in attendance for the big day.

                Shedeur Sanders

title: Guess Who This Low-Key Performer Is!
description:
Guess Who
                          This Low-Key Performer Is!
body:
Guess Who
                          This Low-Key Performer Is!
                      
                  
                        Published November 23, 2025 4:00 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          We all know some actors love to steal the spotlight, but others are just as powerful when they blend into the scenery -- can you guess who this low-key star is?
      
    
          We ran into this guy way back in the day stepping out in the Big Apple, and the guy naturally blended into the hustle and bustle of New York City ... in a borderline Oscar-winning performance!
      
    
          He didn't have an Academy Award at the time, though ... he had to wait until 2023 to pick up one of those!

title: President Trump Praises Shedeur Sanders After Win, 'I TOLD YOU SO'
description:
President Trump
                          Praises Shedeur Sanders After Win
body:
President Trump
                          Praises Shedeur Sanders After Win
                          ... 'I TOLD YOU SO'
                      
                  
                        Published November 24, 2025 7:38 AM PST
                                                                            
              
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Shedeur Sanders was a big winner in his first NFL start ... and while many might be stunned to see the Cleveland Browns have a bit of success, President Donald Trump ain't one of them.
      
    
          No. 45-47 went to Truth Social on Monday to weigh in on the Orange and Brown's 24-10 victory over the Las Vegas Raiders ... and based on what he saw, he's confident he was right about being high on Deion's son.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          "Shedeur Sanders was GREAT," POTUS said minutes ago. "Wins first game, career start, as a pro (for Cleveland). Great Genes. I TOLD YOU SO."
      

          Sanders went 11-20 with 209 yards with a touchdown and a pick in the outing ... marking the first time a Browns quarterback was victorious in his debut since 1995.
      
    
      
      â€” Bleacher Report (@BleacherReport) November 23, 2025
              @BleacherReport
          
  
    
          He had some highlights ... including a 53-yard deep ball to Isaiah Bond in the first quarter that had Coach Prime excited in the Allegiant Stadium stands.
      
    
          Trump previously scolded NFL teams for not drafting Deion's son in the first round of the 2025 NFL Draft ... asking if owners were "stupid" for passing on the Hall of Famer's kid.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          "He should be 'picked' IMMEDIATELY by a team that wants to WIN. Good luck Shedeur, and say hello to your wonderful father!"
      
    
          Sanders ultimately fell all the way to the fifth round.
      
    
          While folks can dissect Sanders' performance all they want, the victory counts all the same ... and that's all that really matters right now for the Dawg Pound.
      
    
      
      â€” SportsCenter (@SportsCenter) November 24, 2025
              @SportsCenter
          
  
    
          Sanders also weighed in after the game ... and he was feeling GOOD -- and claiming it can only get better with more preparation.
      
    
          So, after Trump's time in the Oval Office comes to an end ... perhaps we'll find him in some NFL Draft Day war rooms??

schema.headline: President Trump Praises Shedeur Sanders After Win, 'I TOLD YOU SO'

title: Anna Kepner's Grandparents Speak Out About Stepbrother After Cruise Ship Death
description:
Carnival Cruise Death
                          Anna Kepner's Grandparents Stand By Stepbrother
body:
Carnival Cruise Death
                          Anna Kepner's Grandparents Stand By Stepbrother
                      
                  
                        Published November 24, 2025 7:28 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Anna Kepnerâ€™s grandparents are shutting down any talk she was scared of her stepbrother -- the teen reportedly under investigation in her cruise-ship death -- making it clear they have faith in his innocence.
      
    
          In an ABC News sit-down interview, Barbara and Jeffrey Kepner said 18-year-old Anna and her 16-year-old stepbrother were "two peas in a pod," and cared for each other "in the right way" -- a far cry from what Joshua Tew, Annaâ€™s first love, claimed ... saying her other brother told him about a nasty blowout the pair allegedly had inside the cabin they were all sharing.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The grandparents say authorities told them the stepbrother is considered a suspect in the case. They admit theyâ€™ve got no clue what actually went down inside that cabin -- theyâ€™re waiting on answers just like everyone else -- but pointing the finger at the stepbrother? Theyâ€™re nowhere near ready to go there.
      

                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The family says this cruise was meant to kick off a new tradition -- a big, blended-family getaway -- and they vividly remember the last night they saw Anna. Her braces were bugging her at dinner, but she powered through, stayed for the fun ... then headed back to her room.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          As you know, the cheerleaderâ€™s body was found in that shared cabin on Nov. 8, reportedly wrapped in a blanket and tucked under a bed ... as we reported, she died from asphyxiation reportedly caused by a "bar hold," basically someoneâ€™s arm pressed across her neck. Sheâ€™s not believed to have been sexually assaulted.
      
    
          So far ... no charges have been filed.

title: Reggae Legend Jimmy Cliff Dead at 81
body:
Jimmy Cliff
                          Dead at 81
                      
                  
                        Published November 24, 2025 6:20 AM PST
                                                                      |
                Updated November 24, 2025 7:37 AM PST
                                    
      
    
          Reggae legend Jimmy Cliff has died, his wife Latifa Chambers announced Monday.
      
    
          Latifa wrote ... â€œItâ€™s with profound sadness that I share that my husband, Jimmy Cliff, has crossed over due to a seizure followed by pneumonia. I am thankful for his family, friends, fellow artists and coworkers who have shared his journey with him,â€
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          She continued ... â€œTo all his fans around the world, please know that your support was his strength throughout his whole career. He really appreciated each and every fan for their love. I also wanted to thank Dr. Couceyro and the whole medical staff, as they have been extremely supportive and helpful during this difficult process.â€
      

          Cliff was known for songs like "You Can Get It If You Really Want," "The Harder They Come," and "Many Rivers to Cross" ... songs from the 1972 film "The Harder They Come," in which he starred.
      
    
          The movie was the breakout moment for Jimmy, who was born in Saint James, Jamaica, and had released his first hit song, "Hurricane Hattie," at the age of 14.
      
    
          In his 20s, his career took off internationally thanks to hits like "Wonderful World, Beautiful People" and "Vietnam." His biggest Billboard hit came in 1993, with his top 20 remake of "I Can See Clearly Now" from the "Cool Runnings" soundtrack.
      
    
          According to the Grammy winner's website, "Vietnam" was hailed by Bob Dylan as "the greatest protest song ever written."
      
    
          Cliff was 81.
      
    
          RIP
      
      
              
          
                          
                RIP
              
                          
                Celebrity Death

                Fairly Legal

schema.headline: Reggae Legend Jimmy Cliff Dead at 81
